member.summary: Enables you to switch from application hooks to global hooks and vice versa on the fly without unsubscribing from events. Component remains enabled or disabled state after this call as it was before.

member.summary: Activated upon mouse scrolling.

member.name: E:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.Controls.MouseKeyEventProvider.KeyPress
member.summary: Activated when the user presses a key.
member.remarks:
Key events occur in the following order:
KeyDown
KeyPress
KeyUp
The KeyPress event is not raised by noncharacter keys; however, the noncharacter keys do raise the KeyDown and KeyUp events. Use the KeyChar property to sample keystrokes at run time and to consume or modify a subset of common keystrokes. To handle keyboard events only in your application and not enable other applications to receive keyboard events, set the KeyPressEventArgs.Handled property in your form's KeyPress event-handling method to true.

member.summary: Activated upon the release of a key.

member.summary: Activated when a key is pushed.

KeyUp
The KeyPress event is not raised by noncharacter keys; however, the noncharacter keys do raise the KeyDown and KeyUp events. Use the KeyChar property to sample keystrokes at run time and to consume or modify a subset of common keystrokes. To handle keyboard events only in your application and not enable other applications to receive keyboard events, set the property in your form's KeyPress event-handling method to true.

member.name: T:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.HookCallback
member.summary: The CallWndProc hook procedure is an application-defined or library-defined callback function used with the SetWindowsHookEx function. The HOOKPROC type defines a pointer to this callback function. CallWndProc is a placeholder for the application-defined or library-defined function name.
member.param: [in] Specifies whether the hook procedure must process the message. If nCode is HC_ACTION, the hook procedure must process the message. If nCode is less than zero, the hook procedure must pass the message to the CallNextHookEx function without further processing and must return the value returned by CallNextHookEx.
[in] Specifies whether the message was sent by the current thread. If the message was sent by the current thread, it is nonzero; otherwise, it is zero.
[in] Pointer to a CWPSTRUCT structure that contains details about the message.
member.returns: If nCode is less than zero, the hook procedure must return the value returned by CallNextHookEx. If nCode is greater than or equal to zero, it is highly recommended that you call CallNextHookEx and return the value it returns; otherwise, other applications that have installed WH_CALLWNDPROC hooks will not receive hook notifications and may behave incorrectly as a result. If the hook procedure does not call CallNextHookEx, the return value should be zero.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/winui/winui/windowsuserinterface/windowing/hooks/hookreference/hookfunctions/callwndproc.asp

member.name: M:HookNativeMethods.CallNextHookEx(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The CallNextHookEx function passes the hook information to the next hook procedure in the current hook chain. A hook procedure can call this function either before or after processing the hook information.
member.param: [in] Specifies the hook code passed to the current hook procedure.
[in] Specifies the wParam value passed to the current hook procedure.
[in] Specifies the lParam value passed to the current hook procedure.
member.returns: This value is returned by the next hook procedure in the chain.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/winui/winui/windowsuserinterface/windowing/hooks/hookreference/hookfunctions/setwindowshookex.asp

member.name: M:HookNativeMethods.SetWindowsHookEx(System.Int32,XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.HookCallback,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The SetWindowsHookEx function installs an application-defined hook procedure into a hook chain. You would install a hook procedure to monitor the system for certain types of events. These events are associated either with a specific thread or with all threads in the same desktop as the calling thread.
member.param: [in] Specifies the type of hook procedure to be installed. This parameter can be one of the following values.

[in] Pointer to the hook procedure. If the dwThreadId parameter is zero or specifies the identifier of a thread created by a different process, the lpfn parameter must point to a hook procedure in a dynamic-link library (DLL). Otherwise, lpfn can point to a hook procedure in the code associated with the current process.

[in] Handle to the DLL containing the hook procedure pointed to by the lpfn parameter. The hMod parameter must be set to NULL if the dwThreadId parameter specifies a thread created by the current process and if the hook procedure is within the code associated with the current process.

[in] Specifies the identifier of the thread with which the hook procedure is to be associated. If this parameter is zero, the hook procedure is associated with all existing threads running in the same desktop as the calling thread.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to the hook procedure. If the function fails, the return value is NULL. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/winui/winui/windowsuserinterface/windowing/hooks/hookreference/hookfunctions/setwindowshookex.asp

member.name: M:HookNativeMethods.UnhookWindowsHookEx(System.Int32)
member.summary: The UnhookWindowsHookEx function removes a hook procedure installed in a hook chain by the SetWindowsHookEx function.
member.param: [in] Handle to the hook to be removed. This parameter is a hook handle obtained by a previous call to SetWindowsHookEx.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/winui/winui/windowsuserinterface/windowing/hooks/hookreference/hookfunctions/setwindowshookex.asp

member.returns: HKL

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.ToAscii(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: The ToAscii function translates the specified virtual-key code and keyboard state to the corresponding character or characters. The function translates the code using the input language and physical keyboard layout identified by the keyboard layout handle.
member.param: [in] Specifies the virtual-key code to be translated.
[in] Specifies the hardware scan code of the key to be translated. The high-order bit of this value is set if the key is up (not pressed).

[in] Pointer to a 256-byte array that contains the current keyboard state. Each element (byte) in the array contains the state of one key. If the high-order bit of a byte is set, the key is down (pressed). The low bit, if set, indicates that the key is toggled on. In this function, only the toggle bit of the CAPS LOCK key is relevant. The toggle state of the NUM LOCK and SCROLL LOCK keys is ignored.
[out] Pointer to the buffer that receives the translated character or characters.
[in] Specifies whether a menu is active. This parameter must be 1 if a menu is active, or 0 otherwise.
member.returns: If the specified key is a dead key, the return value is negative. Otherwise, it is one of the following values. Value Meaning 0 The specified virtual key has no translation for the current state of the keyboard. 1 One character was copied to the buffer. 2 Two characters were copied to the buffer. This usually happens when a dead-key character (accent or diacritic) stored in the keyboard layout cannot be composed with the specified virtual key to form a single character.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/winui/winui/windowsuserinterface/userinput/keyboardinput/keyboardinputreference/keyboardinputfunctions/toascii.asp

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.ToUnicodeEx(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Translates the specified virtual-key code and keyboard state to the corresponding Unicode character or characters.
member.param: [in] The virtual-key code to be translated.
[in] The hardware scan code of the key to be translated. The high-order bit of this value is set if the key is up.

[in, optional] A pointer to a 256-byte array that contains the current keyboard state. Each element (byte) in the array contains the state of one key. If the high-order bit of a byte is set, the key is down.

[out] The buffer that receives the translated Unicode character or characters. However, this buffer may be returned without being null-terminated even though the variable name suggests that it is null-terminated.
[in] The size, in characters, of the buffer pointed to by the pwszBuff parameter.
[in] The behavior of the function. If bit 0 is set, a menu is active. Bits 1 through 31 are reserved.
The input locale identifier used to translate the specified code.
member.returns:
-1 <= return <= n
-1 = The specified virtual key is a dead-key character (accent or diacritic). This value is returned regardless of the keyboard layout, even if several characters have been typed and are stored in the keyboard state. If possible, even with Unicode keyboard layouts, the function has written a spacing version of the dead-key character to the buffer specified by pwszBuff. For example, the function writes the character SPACING ACUTE (0x00B4), rather than the character NON_SPACING ACUTE (0x0301).
0 = The specified virtual key has no translation for the current state of the keyboard. Nothing was written to the buffer specified by pwszBuff.
1 = One character was written to the buffer specified by pwszBuff.
n = Two or more characters were written to the buffer specified by pwszBuff. The most common cause for this is that a dead-key character (accent or diacritic) stored in the keyboard layout could not be combined with the specified virtual key to form a single character. However, the buffer may contain more characters than the return value specifies. When this happens, any extra characters are invalid and should be ignored.

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.GetKeyboardState(System.Byte[])
member.summary: The GetKeyboardState function copies the status of the 256 virtual keys to the specified buffer.
member.param: [in] Pointer to a 256-byte array that contains keyboard key states.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/winui/winui/windowsuserinterface/userinput/keyboardinput/keyboardinputreference/keyboardinputfunctions/toascii.asp

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.GetKeyState(System.Int32)
member.summary: The GetKeyState function retrieves the status of the specified virtual key. The status specifies whether the key is up, down, or toggled (on, offalternating each time the key is pressed).
member.param: [in] Specifies a virtual key. If the desired virtual key is a letter or digit (A through Z, a through z, or 0 through 9), nVirtKey must be set to the ASCII value of that character. For other keys, it must be a virtual-key code.
member.returns: The return value specifies the status of the specified virtual key, as follows: If the high-order bit is 1, the key is down; otherwise, it is up. If the low-order bit is 1, the key is toggled. A key, such as the CAPS LOCK key, is toggled if it is turned on. The key is off and untoggled if the low-order bit is 0. A toggle key's indicator light (if any) on the keyboard will be on when the key is toggled, and off when the key is untoggled.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms646301.aspx

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.MapVirtualKeyEx(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Translates (maps) a virtual-key code into a scan code or character value, or translates a scan code into a virtual-key code.
member.param: [in] The virtual key code or scan code for a key. How this value is interpreted depends on the value of the uMapType parameter.
[in] The translation to be performed. The value of this parameter depends on the value of the uCode parameter.
[in] The input locale identifier used to translate the specified code.

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.GetKeyboardLayout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the active input locale identifier (formerly called the keyboard layout) for the specified thread. If the idThread parameter is zero, the input locale identifier for the active thread is returned.
member.param: [in] The identifier of the thread to query, or 0 for the current thread.
member.returns: The return value is the input locale identifier for the thread. The low word contains a Language Identifier for the input language and the high word contains a device handle to the physical layout of the keyboard.

member.summary: uCode is a virtual-key code and is translated into an unshifted character value in the low-order word of the return value. Dead keys (diacritics) are indicated by setting the top bit of the return value. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.KeyboardNativeMethods.MapType.MAPVK_VSC_TO_VK_EX
member.summary: uCode is a scan code and is translated into a virtual-key code that distinguishes between left- and right-hand keys. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_MBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_MBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the middle mouse button

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_LBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the left mouse button

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_RBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the right mouse button

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_MBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_MBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the middle mouse button

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the right mouse button

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_MBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the right mouse button

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_MOUSEWHEEL
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEWHEEL message is posted when the user presses the mouse wheel.

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_XBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_XBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the first or second X mouse button.

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_XBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_XBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the first or second X mouse button.

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the first or second X mouse button.
member.remarks: Only windows that have the CS_DBLCLKS style can receive WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK messages.

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_KEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_KEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is pressed. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed.

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_KEYUP
member.summary: The WM_KEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is released. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed, or a keyboard key that is pressed when a window has the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_SYSKEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user presses the F10 key (which activates the menu bar) or holds down the ALT key and then presses another key. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.Messages.WM_SYSKEYUP
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user releases a key that was pressed while the ALT key was held down. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYUP message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.MouseNativeMethods.GetDoubleClickTime
member.summary: The GetDoubleClickTime function retrieves the current double-click time for the mouse. A double-click is a series of two clicks of the mouse button, the second occurring within a specified time after the first. The double-click time is the maximum number of milliseconds that may occur between the first and second click of a double-click.
member.returns: The return value specifies the current double-click time, in milliseconds.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms646258(VS.85).aspx

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.MouseStruct.Point
member.summary: Specifies a Point structure that contains the X- and Y-coordinates of the cursor, in screen coordinates.

member.name: F:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.MouseStruct.MouseData
member.summary: Specifies information associated with the message.
member.remarks:
The possible values are:
0 - No Information
1 - X-Button1 Click
2 - X-Button2 Click
120 - Mouse Scroll Away from User
-120 - Mouse Scroll Toward User

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.ThreadNativeMethods.GetCurrentThreadId
member.summary: Retrieves the unmanaged thread identifier of the calling thread.

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.ThreadNativeMethods.GetForegroundWindow
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the foreground window (the window with which the user is currently working). The system assigns a slightly higher priority to the thread that creates the foreground window than it does to other threads.

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.GlobalHook.WinApi.ThreadNativeMethods.GetWindowThreadProcessId(System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the identifier of the thread that created the specified window and, optionally, the identifier of the process that created the window.
member.param: A pointer to a variable that receives the process identifier. If this parameter is not NULL, GetWindowThreadProcessId copies the identifier of the process to the variable; otherwise, it does not.
member.returns: The return value is the identifier of the thread that created the window.

member.name: T:XyratexOSC.Licensing.LicenseLock
member.summary: A Wrapper Class to the Sentinel UltraPro security dongle for license verification.
member.remarks: The class verifies a valid license dongle is plugged into the computer on instatiation and through a call to verification (see that can be made at any time throughout the application. If a valid license is found the class does nothing, but if there is any problem with the licensing dongle a will be thrown.

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.Licensing.LicenseLock.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This also includes a license verification call (see ). Check all available design IDs until one is found

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.Licensing.LicenseLock.#ctor(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified dongle DesignID. This also includes a license verification call (see ).
member.exception: The Sentinel UltraPro failed to initialize.

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.Licensing.LicenseLock.Finalize
member.summary: Releases the Ultrapro dongle license.

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.Licensing.LicenseLock.Verify
member.summary: Verifies the security dongle license (except for Xyratex developers). This releases and re-acquires the UltraPro license using our developerID and designID.
member.returns: The result from the verification.

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.Licensing.LicenseLock.Verify(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Verifies the security dongle license (except for Xyratex developers). This releases and re-acquires the UltraPro license using our developerID and the specified designID.
member.returns: The result from the verification.

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.Licensing.LicenseLock.SetFeatures(XyratexOSC.Licensing.LicenseFeatures,System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: [Used internally for key setup]

member.name: P:XyratexOSC.Licensing.LicenseLock.Authentication
member.summary: Gets the value from the last license .
member.value: The type of authentication from the last license verify.

member.name: P:XyratexOSC.Licensing.LicenseLock.XyratexKeyNeeded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Xyratex users require a key.
member.value: true if a key is needed for Xyratex users; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:XyratexOSC.Licensing.NamespaceDoc

summary.para: The namespace is used for checking the XyratexOSC licensing dongle. It contains the wrapper class that connects to and verifies a valid Sentinel UltraPro security dongle is attached to the system.

member.remarks: The class verifies a valid license dongle is plugged into the computer on instatiation and through a call to verification (see that can be made at any time throughout the application. If a valid license is found the class does nothing, but if there is any problem with the licensing dongle a will be thrown.

summary.para: (C) Copyright 2007 SafeNet, Inc. All rights reserved.
This module provide defination and wrappers for UltraPro Dual Client Library APIs

member.name: T:XyratexOSC.Settings.SettingsDocument
member.summary: Represents a settings-file document.

remarks.para: This class provides an in-memory (cache) tree representation of tab-delimited settings files. A SettingsDocument tree can be created in-code, or loaded from a file.
A SettingsDocument contains a keyed and indexed collection of nodes () that each have collections of child nodes. A SettingsDocument is actually a special top-level itself.

member.name: T:XyratexOSC.Settings.SettingsNode
member.summary: Represents a single node of a Settings Document (tab-structured).

remarks.para: The SettingsNode class represents Settings data by the node's name, child nodes, and (optionally) comment information, a defined value type, a read-only setting, and print formatting. The class extends SettingsNode and represents a Settings document. You can use SettingsDocument to load and save Settings data.
While SettingsNodes maintain a tree structure by collections of other SettingsNodes, the ultimate purpose of a SettingsNode is to provide a configuration/setting value for a particular attribute.

A SettingsNode is considered a 'value' when it has no sibling nodes and no child nodes (see ). A node 'has' a value when it contains only a single child 'value' node (see ). The node path leading up to a value node provides a unique identifier for an attribute (ie. Motion|Axis 1|MaxVelocity) and the value node provides it's value.

Values can be strongly typed in-code (see the property) or through an in-line comment in a settings file for a node that has a value '[Type:System.Double]'. Defining a type performs a conversion of the value node to the specified type at load/setting time instead of at read time. It will also cause a node to throw an InvalidCastException if it cannot set a new value to the specified type.

member.name: P:XyratexOSC.Settings.SettingsNode.IsAValue

summary.para: Determines whether this node 'is a value'.
A node is considered a value node when it has no siblings and no children.

member.value: true if this instance is a value; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: A node that 'is a value' can get/set a value, get/set a type, and be accessed from it's parent node (which would 'have' a value) as a value. See for more specifics.

member.name: P:XyratexOSC.Settings.SettingsNode.HasAValue

summary.para: Determines whether this node 'has a value'.
A node is considered to have a value node when it has a single child 'value' node.

member.value: true if this instance has a value; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: A node that 'has a value' can get/set it's value, get/set it's type, and can be validated for reading as a setting by . See for more specifics.

member.name: P:XyratexOSC.Settings.SettingsNode.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this represents an empty (null) node.
member.value: true if this instance is empty; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:XyratexOSC.Settings.SettingsNode.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the node name. If this node is a value node then setting the name will cause the value to change to the type-converted value of the passed string (based on the node type).
member.exception: This node is a value node, and this conversion is not supported. (or) The value is null and conversionType is a value type. (or) The value does not implement the IConvertible interface.

member.name: P:XyratexOSC.Settings.SettingsNode.Info
member.summary: Gets or sets the nodes comments/description. This information is retained in when written to file as a semicolon comment.

member.name: P:XyratexOSC.Settings.SettingsNode.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type for this node. Used only when this node 'is' or 'has' a value. See and .

member.name: P:XyratexOSC.Settings.SettingsNode.IsList
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this node represents a list.
member.value: true if this instance is list; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:XyratexOSC.Settings.SettingsNode.ListLength
member.summary: Gets the list length.

member.name: P:XyratexOSC.Settings.SettingsNode.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for this node if 'is' or 'has' a value. Otherwise, returns null.

remarks.para: If the node , return the previously set value or, if none exists, return the node name converted to the node value . If the node , return the value from it's child 'value' node.
If the node , set it's child node's value, type (based on the value), and name (value.ToString). If the node , setting a new value will convert this to 'having' a value node and create a new child.

member.name: P:XyratexOSC.Settings.SettingsNode.ReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this node's value is Read-Only.
member.value: false if node 'is' or 'has' a value and is not read only; otherwise, true.

summary.para: The namespace is used for processing tab-structured settings files. It contains document, node, and collection classes that can parse, manipulate, and save tab-delimitted settings files.
This namespace is used in sub-system configuration and for loading user/application settings.

remarks.para: The class represents a settings file in memory with reading/writing to file capabilities. The settings documents are built from s that contain a collection of child nodes.

member.name: T:XyratexOSC.Utilities.TimedLock
member.summary: Provides a mechanism that synchronizes access to objects with a specified timeout (using Monitor.TryEnter).
member.remarks: This is a Monitor.TryEnter construct developed by Ian Griffith. http://www.interact-sw.co.uk/iangblog/2004/03/23/locking

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.Utilities.TimedLock.Lock(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempts, for 5 sec, to acquire an exclusive lock on the specified object, and throws a LockTimeoutException if lock could not be taken.
member.param: The object on which to acquire the lock.
member.returns: A TimedLock object which allows for a using statement
member.exception: The lock could not be taken in the specified amount of time.

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.Utilities.TimedLock.Lock(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Attempts, for 5 sec, to acquire an exclusive lock on the specified object, and throws a LockTimeoutException if lock could not be taken.
member.param: The object on which to acquire the lock.
The message to be thrown by the LockTimeoutException.
member.returns: A TimedLock object which allows for a using statement
member.exception: The lock could not be taken in the specified amount of time.

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.Utilities.TimedLock.Lock(System.Object,System.TimeSpan,System.String)
member.summary: Attempts, for the specified amount of time, to acquire an exclusive lock on the specified object, and throws a LockTimeoutException if lock could not be taken.
member.param: The object on which to acquire the lock.
The amount of time to wait for the lock. A value of 1 millisecond specifies an infinite wait.
The message to be thrown by the LockTimeoutException.
member.returns: A TimedLock object which allows for a using statement
member.exception: The lock could not be taken in the specified amount of time.

member.name: M:XyratexOSC.Utilities.TimedLock.Dispose
member.summary: Releases the TimedLock.
